titles.title: For the relief of Akal Security, Incorporated.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 106-581.

calendar.text: Placed on the Private Calendar, Calendar No. 12.

action.text: Called up from the Private Calendar for consideration.

vote.text: On passage Passed by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Administrative Oversight and the Courts.
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 11/10/1999--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to pay, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, a specified sum to a named New Mexico corporation in full satisfaction of all claims against the United States for security guard services rendered in 1991 to the U.S. Army Reserve Personnel Center located at 9700 Page Boulevard in St. Louis, Missouri.
